segments.narrationText: Meeting Highlights automatically generates 2-3 minute video recaps of your meetings.
It combines AI summaries with authentic video clips, preserving tone and discussion flow.
segments.visualDescription: Split screen showing AI summaries + authentic video clips

segments.narrationText: Catch up on meetings without watching hour-long recordings.
Meeting Highlights combines two distinct types of highlights to create a comprehensive recap.

First, abstractive highlights. These are AI-generated summaries that capture the key topics discussed in the meeting, using original video from the meeting. The narration is powered by Azure Cognitive Services text-to-speech.
segments.visualDescription: Left card appears - Abstractive Highlights with summary icon

segments.narrationText: Second, key moments. These are significant verbatim segments extracted directly from the meeting, using the original audio and video from the recording.
segments.visualDescription: Right card appears - Key Moments with video clip icon

segments.narrationText: Each highlight is a 20 to 40 second segment with precise timestamps and accompanying narration.
The AI weaves these highlights together into a cohesive narrative, creating an engaging story that connects the abstractive summaries and key moments.
Access Meeting Highlights through BizChat.
Open BizChat and ask for a meeting recap.

segments.narrationText: Tip: Type forward slash to easily reference meetings using C-I-Q.

segments.narrationText: You can also access Meeting Highlights directly from SharePoint.
Open the meeting chat in Teams.
segments.visualDescription: Video player appears showing SharePoint demo

segments.narrationText: Navigate to the meeting recording recap page by clicking the recording link or via the Recap tab.
Click the Watch in browser button.
Then click Play highlights. A new page should open with the highlights player ready to recap your meeting.
Meeting Highlights required the collaboration of six teams within Microsoft for a cross-organizational effort. Let me show you how each team contribute to the project through the architecture.
ODSP handles storage and video manifest. When meetings end, it initiates highlight generation.
MSAI-Hive processes transcripts using LLMs to generate highlight metadata.
BizChat provides natural language access through conversational queries.
SharePoint offers direct access from meeting recap pages. This interface was implemented by the Clipchamp team.
Teams access planned as another interface option.
Loop embeds the Clipchamp player across applications.
Clipchamp delivers the player experience without creating new video files.
Together, these teams deliver a unified end-to-end experience from recording through AI processing to user access, showcasing true One Microsoft collaboration.
Our current Meeting Highlights implementation makes 4 sequential calls to L-L-M, with a large amount of tokens. To enable global scaling, we needed to dramatically reduce these computational costs.
Our solution was to collapse the four sequential steps into one unified prompt. By designing a single comprehensive prompt that accomplishes the same four steps in one L-L-M call.
Beyond reducing L-L-M calls, we optimized the input tokens themselves, which reduced input tokens by more than 60 percent.
Required GPU capacity dropped 70%: from 600 to under 200.
Early internal feedback strongly prefers unified prompt highlight videos over the multi-call pipeline output. The gains center on depth and natural flow.
These improvements are the next step: enabling GA within capacity constraints.
